issue.title: [DocDB] reenable LogReader memory limit

labels.name: kind/enhancement
labels.description: This is an enhancement of an existing feature

repository.name: yugabyte-db
repository.description: YugabyteDB - the cloud native distributed SQL database for mission-critical applications.

issue.body:
Jira Link: [DB-19028](https://yugabyte.atlassian.net/browse/DB-19028)
### Description

This had to be temporarily disabled due to a bug in TryConsume (see [#29095: DocDB Temporarily disable use of TryConsume by LogReader](https://github.com/yugabyte/yugabyte-db/issues/29095))

That bug has been fixed so it is time to turn this back on again.

This will reenable [#28268: DocDB Add limit for temporary memory used by  xCluster reading WALs](https://github.com/yugabyte/yugabyte-db/issues/28268)

this should be backported to 2024.2, 2025.1, 2025.2


### Issue Type

kind/enhancement

### Warning: Please confirm that this issue does not contain any sensitive information

- [x] I confirm this issue does not contain any sensitive information.
